credentials: PHD 2007 Univ of California Los Angeles
name: JENNA NOBLES

ratings.comment: I liked Jenna a lot! She did a great job explaining concepts and was very friendly and likeable.

Jenna is an amazing professor and a caring person! She cares about her students and you can tell she loves her job! Soc 170 was easy if you pay attention and study, but the class is interesting so studying shouldn't be a problem! Highly recommend!!
I really liked her!
She made lectures interesting. easy class overall. very good prof

Your grade is made up of 2 tests, 2 papers, daily reading quizzes and discussion participation. Content heavy but Professor Nobles cares about the class and the content. She wants to help her students and is available outside of class.

So much content packed into lectures. Long readings twice a week and long jam packed lectures are all on tests. There are small quizzes twice a week that are not difficult at all and they do not really help for the 2 big exams in the course.

Soc 170 was a good beginner sociology. There are two exams that are not challenging if you prepare but they are multiple which is always difficult. The two papers are based off the book you read throughout. I really enjoyed reading The Color of Law. Overall, Nobles was great, accessible (go to office hours!), and helpful.

Overall I thought this class was pretty easy, interesting, and well taught. At least in the online format, there are 3 credit hours to attend plus some weekly readings. Before the class, you are expected to have read 2-3 10-20 page readings. Lectures focus on key points of readings. If you are willing to read this class should be an easy A.

Jenna is a solid lecturer and always seemed happy to help clear up any confusion. We had two exams, two papers, and some relatively short weekly readings, all of which were pretty easy. On the both the exams, she gave everyone an extra 10% even if that brought you over 100.

Prof. Nobles was so invested in what she was teaching and her lectures really showed how excited she was about the content. Exams were mult choice but she worked with the TAs to get as much practice as possible and gave a good curve. Papers were graded super easily, just read the book. Don't waste time with pre-lecture readings, just answer the ?s

She's a pretty good lecturer and is very knowledgeable about the subject. Does a great job at encouraging students to develop useful skills like critically thinking about charts and graphs shown in class. Many TAs did not seem very good and made the class more stressful than it needed to be, but exams are pretty easy as long as you go to lecture.

Prof. Jenna Nobles is easily one of my favorite professors I have had at UW. She is so intelligent and passionate about teaching her students. She truly wanted all of us to succeed and gave out a large extra credit assignment at the end of the semester also.
She cares about her students a lot. There are weekly quizzes to improve your grade. The tests aren't too hard if you study. She has review sessions before the tests.

Jenna is a great person and really wants to see the class succeed, such as removing the final that would be at 9 pm - which really brings into question how terrible the exams are. When taking exams you can easily tell which questions she wrote versus what questions the TAs wrote. Class itself is easy, but the exams are way too specific.

So much reading, two of the TA's were not very good. One talked about the students behind their backs while I was in the room. The content was interesting, but no matter how much I read or studied I couldn't do well on the exams. Below C average on exams for a class of 400. Gave extra credit option at the end to raise scores.

Lectures were super dry and jam packed with so much information it was hard to tell what was necessary and what wasn't. So much outside reading and a lot of that is unnecessary as well. Tests were hard even if you crammed, if you aren't a soc major I wouldn't recommend this for soc credit

Course was nearly impossible. I went to all the lectures and did all the readings but barley scraped by with an AB. The exams were so difficult with tricky wording and extremely specific examples from readings that were not discussed in the course ever. Take a different course to fulfill your ethnic studies requirement.

I went to four lectures all semester and got an AB in the class. If you do the reading and go to discussion you will do fine. Exams are multiple choice. Don't expect to know your grade until the very end because they take a long time to grade anything. The papers are graded very easily.
SO much reading for a 100 level class. Do NOT take if looking for an easy ethnic studies requirement. Totally soiled my GPA and was not in the least bit enjoyable or interesting.

Two lectures a week, which is fine. But she expects you to read multiple (2 or 3) 30-50 page readings PER LECTURE. Absolutely ridiculous for a 100 level class. Lectures are boring, but necessary to go to if you want to pass the class. My TA was okay, but never replied to emails when I tried to set up appointments to come into her office hours.

This class is content heavy. A lot of long readings. If you are taking this to fulfill an ethnic studies class, its a lot harder than some of the other ones. Grades consist of 2 midterms, a final and two papers. Tests are somewhat difficult and confusing. Make sure you study the readings and lecture slides well.

Her class is pretty easy as long as you attend lecture. The exams are directly from the lecture material. She goes over what you need to know from the readings in class, so it's not necessary to read them to do well.
Great professor. Not much homework assigned. Just go to lecture and you will have no problem.
Easy class that fulfills a social science and ethnics studies requirement. Relatively interesting subject and little to no homework.
Very nice professor who saturates you with a lot of information.  Tests were average but required preparation for sure.  However, it is tough to guess what she is going to put on the tests.

Good, fair professor. I read all of the reading, some were completely unnecessary, but some of the material that we read was on the test. DO THE READINGS. Also study for her tests, they are by no means easy.

Great teacher, really cared about students. Class isn't too bad. Make sure to go to discussion and do the extra credit. Also, class is really helpful, and substitutes for not reading. It's not necessarily an easy A, but it's actually interesting and professor Nobles is great.

She is obviously very passionate and knowledgeable about what she teaches which makes the class more interesting. I personally did not find the class challenging but knew friends who struggled. She posts the majority of lecture slides online which makes up for going fast sometimes in lecture. Do the extra credit, interesting and not too hard.

Good prof and tried to make sure everyone understood the concepts. The material can be interesting. Readings are mentioned a lot in lecture/exams, and there are a lot of readings, so I would suggest that you at least skim them. Exams are 80% of your grade but there are no long projects/papers. They aren't too difficult, but some studying is needed.

Prof Nobles is extremely intelligent and passionate about the field she is studying. She is very helpful and often asks for the student's input about how she can improve the class. There are no textbooks, but you do read a lot articles. Overall, I would recommend taking the class. It's interesting and gives you a lot to think about.
Good ethnic studies class to take if you're in need of the credit. Not a ton of work, don't really need to go to lecture but some of the stuff is interesting.

She assigns way too much reading.  However, they aren't particularly necessary, as I didn't read them and managed an AB in the class.  My beef with her is that she goes way too fast in lecture, you practically need a laptop to take notes. She gives extra credit opportunities. 2 midterms, 1 final. This class is golden for ethnic studies credit.
I thought she was pretty good. Tried to make sure everyone understood the concepts. Multiple opportunities for extra credit, and the class wasn't that hard to begin with.
The class is a lot harder than it needed to be. 1st midterm average was 64% and this is not even a math class. She does not curve your final grade.

Jenna is very helpful and the exams had essay, multiple choice, and short answer. Lots of reading but not really necessary if you go to lecture. Do optional presentation, and understand the essay questions given prior to each exam. Overall easy, but you need to study.
Easy class. I rarely did the required readings and still got an A in the class by just attending lecture
